intro: Terminalia supitiana, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, palmate leaves. The tree produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by orange-red berries. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Terminalia supitiana is valued for its ornamental beauty and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
